sections.text:
RCW 9A.12.010

To establish the defense of insanity, it must be shown that:(1) At the time of the commission of the offense, as a result of mental disease or defect, the mind of the actor was affected to such an extent that:(a) He or she was unable to perceive the nature and quality of the act with which he or she is charged; or(b) He or she was unable to tell right from wrong with reference to the particular act charged.(2) The defense of insanity must be established by a preponderance of the evidence.

To establish the defense of insanity, it must be shown that:

(1) At the time of the commission of the offense, as a result of mental disease or defect, the mind of the actor was affected to such an extent that:

(a) He or she was unable to perceive the nature and quality of the act with which he or she is charged; or

(b) He or she was unable to tell right from wrong with reference to the particular act charged.

(2) The defense of insanity must be established by a preponderance of the evidence.

[ 2011 c 336 s 353; 1975 1st ex.s. c 260 s 9A.12.010.]
